properties.Name: Clear Hills
properties.Location: 80 km northwest of the town of Peace River on the eastern edge of the Clear Hills.
properties.Host_Rock: Sandstone consisting of ooids, siderite and clastic material embedded in clastic matrix and ferrogineous cement.
properties.Ref_Rep: Gilles, A., Johnson, M. (2012): Technical Report on the Rambling Creek-North Whitemud River oolitic irostone depsoit, Clear Hills, Alberta, 95 p.
properties.R_Summary: Combined Rambling Creek-North River portions. The indicated resource contains 557 738 tonnes at 33.30 % Fe. The inferred resource contains 94 664 tonnes at 34.11 % Fe.

properties.Name: Sturgeon Lake
properties.Location: West-Central Alberta, 50 km south of Valleyview.
properties.Other_Comm: Potassium, Boron, Bromine,  Calcium, Magnesium, Sodium
properties.Ref_Rep: Eccles, R., Dufresne, M. (2016): NI 43-101 Technical Report, Sturgeon Lake Li-K-Br-Ca-Mg-Na Oilfield brine inferred mineral resource, Leduc Property, West-Central Alberta, 74 p.
properties.R_Summary: Inferred resources of 5.7 billion cubic metres of brine containing 385 000 tonnes of Li at 67.5 mg/L, 26.5 million tonnes of K, 650 000 tonnes of B, 2.3 million tonnes of Br, 134.5 million tonnes of Ca, 16.5 million tonnes of Mg and 355.6 tonnes of Na.

properties.Name: Fox Creek
properties.Location: Swan Hills, 20 km northeast of town Fox Creek and 60 km west of Whitecourt.
properties.Other_Comm: Potassium, Boron, Bromine,  Calcium, Magnesium, Sodium
properties.Geo_Unit: Leduc Formation and Beaverhill Lake Group
properties.Ref_Rep: Eccles, R., Dufresne, M, McMillan, K., Touw, J., Clissold, R. (2012): NI 43-101 Technical Report, Maiden Li-K-B-Br-Ca-Mg-Na Resource Estimate on Lithium-enriched Formation Water, Fox Creek property, West-Central Alberta, 202 p.
properties.R_Summary: In-place tonnage estimates comprise 362 000 tonnes of Li at 88.3 mg/L, 18.8 million tonnes of K, 694 000 tonnes of B, 1.3 million tonnes of Br, 54.8 million tonnes of Ca, 11.6 million tonnes of Mg, and 245.2 million tonnes of Na.

properties.Name: Firebag
properties.Location: Northeastern Alberta, 95 km north of Fort McMurray.
properties.Ref_Rep: Eccles, R., Zdunczyk, M., Nicholls, S. (2014): NI 43-101 Technical Report, Inferred Frac Sand Resource Estimate for the Firebag Property, Northeastern Alberta, Canada, 136 p.
properties.Ref_PEA_Rep: Hannah, T. and Lavender, T. (2015): Preliminary Economic Assessment Firebag River Sand Property, submitted to Athabasca Minerals Incorporated, 156 p.
properties.R_Summary: Inferred resource estimates a 39.120 million tonnes of silica sand. Mineable resource estimate is 22,727,650 of clean metric tonnes. The silica sand  is well within the ISO 13503-2:2006/Amd.1:2009E recommendations for proppant.

properties.Name: Buckton
properties.Location: 120 km north of Fort McMurray on the eastern slopes of the Birch Mountains.
properties.Other_Comm: Nickel, Uranium, Copper, Cobalt, Rare Earth Oxides, Scandium Oxide
properties.Geo_Unit: Second White Specks and Labiche formations
properties.Ref_Rep: Eccles, R., Nicholls, S., Dufresne, M. (2013a): NI 43-101 Technical Report, Consolidated and updated inferred resource estimate for the Buckton Zone, SBH property, northeastern Alberta, 135 p.
properties.Ref_PEA_Rep: Puritch, E., Eccles, R., Dufresne, M., Nicholls, S., Kuchling, K., Watts, G., Rodgers, K., Cron, B. (2014): NI 43-101F1 Technical Report, Preliminary economic assessment for the Buckton deposit SBH property, north-east Alberta, 237 p.
properties.R_Summary: Inferred mineral resource of 4.4 billion tonnes and indicated resource of 271 million tonnes of aggregate of mineralized material per resource study. Â Recoverable metals include Ni, U, Zn, Cu, Co, REE, Sc, Mo, Li, V and Th. Indicated resource total shale package: of 496 million tonnes of shale package: 20.15  tonnes recoverable REE oxides, 7.13 tonnes Y2O3, 1.13 tonnes Sc, 2.612.56 tonnes V2O5, 12.23 tonnes Ni, 24.72 tonnes Zn, 2.8 tonnes Cu, 3.2 tonnes Co, 2.08 tonnes U3O8, 0.22 tonnes MoO3,  17.22 tonnes Li2CO3.

properties.Name: Buckton South
properties.Location: Eastern flanks of the Birch Mountains.
properties.Other_Comm: Zinc, Nickel, Rare Earth Elements, Ytrium, Scandium, Thorium, Molybdenum
properties.Ref_Rep: Eccles, D.R., Nicholls, S. and Dufresne, M.B. (2013): Maiden inferred resource estimate for the Buckton South Zone, SBH Property, northeast Alberta, 115 p.
properties.R_Summary: Inferred mineral resource of 496 million tonnes of shale package: 41.85  tonnes recoverable REE oxides, 13.2 tonnes Y2O3, 88.5 tonnes V2O5, 30 tonnes Ni, 75 tonnes Zn, 14.7 tonnes Cu, 6.3 tonnes Co, 5 tonnes U3O8, 6.5 tonnes MoO3, 78 tonnes Li2CO3.

properties.Name: Swan Hills
properties.Location: West-Central Alberta, south of Swan Hills.
properties.Ref_Rep: Dufresne, M. (2015): Assessment report for 2012-2014 exploration on the Swan Hills bentonitic clay property, West-central Alberta, Alberta Energy Mineral Assesment Report 20150004, 37 p.
properties.R_Summary: Inferred resource of 54.3 million tonnes assumes gravity of 2.2 kg/m3, with 60% of the clay being smectite. Additional deeper Inferred Mineral Resource of 74 million tonnes with average grade of 40.5% total clay minerals

properties.Name: Richardson
properties.Location: Northeastern Alberta, 80 km northeast of Fort Mackay.
properties.Ref_Rep: Eccles, R., Atkinson, B., Nicholls, S. ( 2015): NI 43-101 Technical Report, Inferred Crush Rock Aggregate Resource Estimate for the Richardson Property, Northeastern Alberta, Canada, 136 p.
properties.R_Summary: Inferred crushed rock aggregate of 683.14 million tonnes; density of 2.68 t/m3. It is overlain by 497 million tonnes of overburden-waste material.

properties.Name: Central Clearwater
properties.Ref_Rep: Spanjers, R., MacMillan, G. and Monnery, W. (2017): NI 43-101 Technical Report, Lithium Resource estimate for the North Rocky Property, south-central Alberta, Canada, 75 p.
properties.R_Summary: Inferred resource of 4.6 billion cubic metres at an average grade of 77.4 mg/L

properties.Name: North Rocky
properties.Ref_Rep: Spanjers, R., MacMillan, G. and Monnery, W. (2017): NI 43-101 Technical Report, Lithium Resource estimate for the Central Clearwater Property, south-central Alberta, Canada, 74 p.
properties.R_Summary: Inferred resource of 3.3 billion cubic metres at an average grade of 52.9 mg/L

properties.Name: Exshaw West
properties.Ref_Rep: MacMillan, G. and Binks, G. (2018): NI 43-101 Technical Report, Lithium Resource estimate for the Exshaw West Property, south-central Alberta, Canada, 80 p.
properties.R_Summary: Inferred resource of 19.5 billion cubic metres at an average grade of 75 mg/L

properties.Name: Burmis (Marasek)
properties.Location: Crowsnest Pass, 9 km east and northeast of Blairmore, on the eastern slope of the Livingstone Range.
properties.Ref_Rep: Dufresne, M. (2003): Technical Report on Burmis Magnetite Deposits, Crowsnest Pass, Southwest Alberta, 63 p.
properties.R_Summary: Historical indicated resource (non NI 43-101 compliant) of 111 200 tonnes of rock yielding an average grade of about 60 wt% magnetic minerals.

properties.Name: Pelican Mountain
properties.Ref_Rep: Faragher, T. and Dahrouge, J. (2000): 1998 to 2000 exploration of the Pelican Mountain Property, Alberta Energy Mineral Assessment Report 20000019, 101 p.
properties.R_Summary:
Inferred resources of 13.72 million tonnes of heavy mineral sand at a grade of 3.33 % TiO2.
occurrence total about 13. 72 mt with 3.33 per cent TiO2.

properties.Name: Duvernay
properties.Location: 8 km southeast of the town of Athabasca, White Rabbit property.
properties.Ref_Rep: Hunter, A.C. and Turner, W.A. (2019): Technical Report White Rabbit Property, Alberta, Canada, 89 p.
properties.R_Summary: In-place resources, measured 24.7 million tonnes, indicated 5.6 million tonnes, inferred 4.9 million tonnes.
